--- title: "Spotify" author: "Nada Trabelsi" date: "2024-03-08" categories: [code] image: "spotify_img.png" execute: warning: false message: false code-tools: true toc: true format: html: default ipynb: default format-links: [ipynb] --- ## Loading the Dataset ::: {.cell execution_count=1} ``` {.python .cell-code} import pandas as pd spotify = pd.read_csv('https://bcdanl.github.io/data/spotify_all.csv') spotify.info() ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout} ``` RangeIndex: 198005 entries, 0 to 198004 Data columns (total 7 columns): # Column Non-Null Count Dtype --- ------ -------------- ----- 0 pid 198005 non-null int64 1 playlist_name 198005 non-null object 2 pos 198005 non-null int64 3 artist_name 198005 non-null object 4 track_name 198005 non-null object 5 duration_ms 198005 non-null int64 6 album_name 198005 non-null object dtypes: int64(3), object(4) memory usage: 10.6+ MB ``` ::: ::: ## Variable Description * pid: playlist ID; unique ID for playlist * playlist_name: a name of playlist * pos: a position of the track within a playlist (starting from 0) * artist_name: name of the track‚Äôs primary artist * track_name: name of the track * duration_ms: duration of the track in milliseconds * album_name: name of the track‚Äôs album ## Filtering I will filter for one of my favorite artists: Shakira. ::: {.cell execution_count=2} ``` {.python .cell-code} shakira = spotify[ spotify["artist_name"] == "Shakira"] shakira ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-display execution_count=14} ```{=html}

``` ::: ::: ## Indexing and Sorting ::: {.cell execution_count=3} ``` {.python .cell-code} shakira= ( shakira .set_index("pid") .sort_index(ascending=True) ) shakira.sort_values(by = ["playlist_name", "pos"], ascending = True) ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-display execution_count=15} ```{=html}

``` ::: ::: ## Counting ::: {.cell execution_count=4} ``` {.python .cell-code} shakira.nunique() ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-display execution_count=16} ``` playlist_name 116 pos 86 artist_name 1 track_name 35 duration_ms 36 album_name 12 dtype: int64 ``` ::: ::: There are 116 unique playlists that have atleast 1 Shakira song in it. ::: {.cell execution_count=5} ``` {.python .cell-code} shakira['playlist_name'].value_counts() ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-display execution_count=17} ``` playlist_name üíÉüèΩ 9 musica 7 spanish jams 6 GB 6 Party 4 .. Taylor swift 1 Gabriel 1 weekend 1 misc. 1 everything 1 Name: count, Length: 116, dtype: int64 ``` ::: ::: The playlist with the most Shakira songs is "üíÉ" with 9 songs included. ::: {.cell execution_count=6} ``` {.python .cell-code} shakira["track_name"].value_counts() ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-display execution_count=18} ``` track_name Hips Don't Lie 53 Chantaje 18 La Tortura 13 Waka Waka (This Time for Africa) (The Official 2010 FIFA World Cup (TM) Song) 12 Try Everything - From "Zootropolis" 9 Can't Remember to Forget You 9 Whenever, Wherever 8 Me Enamor√© 7 Rabiosa 5 Perro Fiel 4 Loca 4 Addicted to You 4 Ojos As√≠ 2 Trap 2 Underneath Your Clothes 2 She Wolf 2 Gordita 2 Te Aviso, Te Anuncio (Tango) 1 Empire 1 Lo Hecho Est√° Hecho 1 Eyes Like Yours (Ojos As√≠) 1 La La La 1 Suerte (Whenever, Wherever) 1 You Don't Care About Me 1 Loca por Ti 1 Sombra de Ti 1 Ciega, Sordomuda 1 Antologia 1 Moscas en la Casa 1 Pienso en Ti 1 Dare (La La La) 1 No 1 Gypsy 1 Don't Bother 1 Nunca Me Acuerdo de Olvidarte 1 Name: count, dtype: int64 ``` ::: ::: The most popular song (added to playlist the most times) is "Hips Don't Lie".
